Review Text: For sure not Marriott standard. Will never go there again. The staff is very friendly and at least tries their best to help. Breakfast is sometimes a la cart and sometimes not. Anyway they will bring something you have not ordered. Price per night, food, drinks much to high and not worth it!

Review Title: Not up to former Protea standards
Review Text: Visiting a protea in Nigeria used to be a pleasure but since its relationship with Marriot quality of certain aspects has declined although not yet to the level of the former Sheraton in Abuja. Rooms are OK and the beds up to usual Sheraton standard. Pool is nice and the location facing the ocean pleasant if you have a room with a view. Access to the hotel is via a road in pretty poor shape.. Gym is small with a couple of treadmills, a gym machine, couple of bikes and a manual elliptical trainer. For me the pleasure of a Protea was its fantastic breakfast buffet. Sad to report this is no longer available with a very poor selection, instant coffee only, no decent meats or cheese, no pastries . Overall very disappointing for N14,00 ($30).. Internet connectivity just about OK..

By far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at.  I booked my hotel at the official Marriott website using my points.  Just three days before I arrived I received an email from Marriott welcoming me to the hotel.  However, when I arrived, at check-in, I was informed by the front desk agent (Grace) that Marriott points were not accepted at the hotel, but that they would be willing to offer me a special rate for each night.  I had no prior notice, they didn’t notify me by email or any other means, but they refused to accept my reservation that was guaranteed by Marriott.  After discussing it with the manager on duty (Ms. Tokunbo), we agreed on a rate, and they agreed to return my points back to my Marriott account.  However, they did not accept international credit cards (their

Our stay at Protea Hotel was not nice. The staff are rude. We made payments for 2 nights with breakfast inclusive. And I was told that I will be given a refund for not eating breakfast the morning I was checking out by the front desk officer. She even requested for my account details which I provided immediately only for them to turn around to say I don't have a refund. If Protea was not giving me a refund, they should have advice me to take my breakfast or forfeit the refund, which they did not say. Before I checked out. I have evidence of the WhatsApp number giving to me to send in the account details, and it was acknowledged. They have integrity issues, no transparent communication.  This is not a good experience for a first visit.

I would advice anyone going here to be very careful. The service is incredibly horrible. I'm not sure how it can still be under the Marriott brand which is very good. I had the worst experience  and secondly, I have tried to reach them on several occasions  to get some information  about my stay and they have given me the run around. It's like I'm dealing with a ghetto hotel not a marriott brand. I only stay at Mareiotts and this is a big shame.

Review Title: TERRIBLE EXPERINCE , MOLD EVERYWHERE IN THE BATH ROOM & NO ELECTRICAL OUTLET IN THE BATHROOM
Review Text: I arrived at this Hotel on the 6th of November @ 7:00pm I couldn't   check in until 11:30, after I checked in I fund out  the bath room was horrible tight like mobile restroom, & mold everywhere, also no electrical outlet in the bathroom , The manager said it is structural malfunction which is very sad. I was supposed to spend 12 night and I check out the next Day.

Protea Hotel Kuramo Waters was a refreshing experience for me. From the front desk to the restuarant staff to hosekeeping, i will like to say thank you for being so wonderful. from check in, i felt like i was home. this review is more about the integrity and honesty of one of the house keeping staff, Taiwo and the front desk staff. i forgot my wristwatch in my room. 2 hoiurs after checkout, i received an email from the hotel staff notifying me that they had the watch. the watch is a family heirloom and has very significant and emotional value. i was able to pick the watch a couple of hours later. Thank you so much for being wonderful human beings. This is now my new home away from home when i am in Lagos. the hotel is very quiet and arranged like villas
Room Tips: Ask for the water view or close to the pool

Review Text: Protea kuramo is simply an awesome out of home experience. The food. ambience, decor all work together to make your stay pleasant and memorable. I had the seafood platter which was a feast for a king. The pool is just excellent and I would be surely coming back soon.

The view of the lake is great! But .. the hotel is not up to per, the facilities are old, bathrooms terribly small and uncomfortable, the rooms don't have natural lighting and windows have some green/blue film barrier that just keeps you in, rooms are dark ish because of this and the rooms feel stuffy and musky. The view's good and pool nice, staff hospitable but I would not recommend staying there :( I've never been happier to check out. I constantly considered checking out, and I actually tried to.

Large rooms, nice and small pool, the gym is small with no TV. However, if you manage to come to Lagos, you probably do not look for luxuries but for basic place. Breakfast has a nice variety of food, with CNN on the background.
Review Text

VENUE  The hotel was very difficult to find.  It is in central Victoria island which is very good for business but it was in a quiet close that was hard to find. I had to call the hotel for directions. I think it should be signposted from the major road. The hotel is a collection of detached buildings in a gated secure area by the ocean.  PARKING There is complimentary parking on the site. Parking is safe and secure.  CHECK IN I Arrived for check in at 6.05pm. Check in was brisk. Within a few minutes I was settled in my room with a large balcony overlooking the Kuramo waters.  LOBBY The lobby was a bit bright and flashy for a Marriott but the staff were professional and friendly.  ROOM There are six units. Each unit has three rooms upstairs, two downstairs and a penthouse. I had

Location is ok, abit underutilised since no beach access, pricey compared to options in same location, mosquitoes are a problem also. Staff are pleasant, especially Miss Tolu, she's a gem. Will visit if standards improve again sometime.

The hotel is situated next to the sea, it is very peaceful and the staff are amazing. The meals that were prepared were excellent and all round the service and friendliness of the staff is exceptional. I have recommended the hotel to all my colleagues. I was extremely impressed.

Review Title: Dated Non-Hotel in a decent location
Review Text: A very dated property that looks and feels more like a Residential Apartment community than a nice Hotel -especially. Not a Marriott chain hotel. Unless you really want to score loyalty  points with Marriott, stay away this place, as it is not cheap either.  They certainly need to do a makeover and give this place a facelift if they need to get more customers   LOCATION: Lovely location right. Next to the waterfront. Quick taxi. Ride away from most points of interest.   DINE + DRINK:  The Piano bar in the lobby level is a non-bar, but the restaurant on the first floor is pretty good. Do not miss the LOCAL FAVORITES they dish out, as they are pretty authentic and delicious! The breakfast spread is lovely too – with both. International and. Excellent local dishes!   ROOM: We

Arrival was handled very smooth and front desk was spot on. room OK - could need some TLC. beach line amazing and view was breath taking from our room. 4 star for real however recommend some improvement in food offer/ speed of service/ variety of meals and overall we didnt see a manager around. will be back and will tell ALL our friends, GEM in Nigeria and easily one of the very top protea we have stayed in!

Review Title: I could not  stay a night
Review Text: We decided to inspect the property on arrival before check in and it looked dirty, broken down and not well maintained. I immediately cancelled my reservation and looked for another hotel which was very difficult considering the hour of the night

Review Title: Don't bother!. Breakfast services IS VERY POOR!
Review Text: Stayed at few hotels including this one over the years. This last stay was terrible at breakfast there are not enough food, you wait for a waiter to go and bring slices of bread, you wait for a  man with one frying pan to prepare omelette for 100 guest, you open any food trays its all empty, and you wonder where is the breakfast? . Waiters running up and down each time a guest need things that should have been readily available. There must be a regime of austerity going on at this hotel. Great staff all in all when you talk to them, however i guess they are restricted its like someone in the back room is saying '' You can only put 6 slices of bread on the counter every 2 hours'.  Fair price, clean room. Don't dare ask the check-in receptionist for a spare key card - THEY WONT

I stayed almost 5 days in this hotel. Trust me for the money it takes - its like burning your dollars. on business trip if u aint get decent Internet God save ur trip. this is the first hotel ever where the routers are put outside the premises... tied with a chord on the boundary wall.   rooms are smaller than shown , by miles. If u think its beach front hotel - HIGHLY MISTAKEN, U CANT GO TO BEACH. PERIOD. If ur room is sideway u won't even see the sea. The chef have no idea what food is needed in the hotel. No one can solve ur any problem. Including the ED. so if u r not an African highly recommended don't even enter . IBIS at airport road is 10 times better than this ... in food and internet. Lavish ranges of food with themes of cuisines. (stayed there too last day due to

Using the same hotel for the last 2 years when im in lagos Its. nice hotel, nice costumer service and nice food... the beds and pillows are  very comfortable. the room service Is very professional and good... love the fish there.. thank you For your welcoming. See you soon.

Nice people and Hotel but the food and restaurant service is a big detractor for this hotel. I have stayed here twice in the last month and thought it might have improved but it did not.   Everything takes 35 minutes to cook and when it shows up it is not always what you asked for. There are many restaurants close buy which I would recommend you go to if you stay here.
Review Text

VENUE  The hotel was very difficult to find.  It is in central Victoria island which is very good for business but it was in a quiet close that was hard to find. I had to call the hotel for directions. I think it should be signposted from the major road. The hotel is a collection of detached buildings in a gated secure area by the ocean. Everything takes 35 minutes to cook and when it shows up it is not always what you asked for. There are many restaurants close buy which I would recommend you go to if you stay here.
Review Text

With a great location by Kuramo waters and a lovely view, privacy away from the madness of Victoria Island, courteous staff, this hotel is let down by the mediocre level of hygiene. I had to ask for room to be cleaned again my my presence before I could unpack. The room was dusty, nooks and crannies dirty, remote control had crust, windows not cleaned in years, floor mopped but not swept. I decided as I unpacked that I would not shower there but rather stay the night and shower elsewhere. Just a little bit of effort could take this hotel to another level.

I will advice you not to think of staying at this hotel. The view to the beach is tempting but please don't deceived by it.   I booked this place with the aim of staying for two nights but I had to check out the next day. Rooms too small. The bathroom is so tiny you can hardly move around in it.  I gave it two stars because of the nice staff and the location.

Stayed here a number of different times over 2 years, always a good spot with friendly staff, and good food and drink, there is also a pool and gym. With outside area for having a quiet smoke and a beer. Very safe and secure.

It was an amazing stay at the property.  Highly maintained, secure, relaxing and very private. Beautiful furniture & decor; the bathroom was a big hit! 5***** treatment The seaview, the sea breeze, the swimming pool all made our stay wonderful

Review Title: The Place to stay, Business and Pleasure
Review Text: I loved the privacy and the serenity of the hotel. It has rooms that have Ocean View. The pool, though I didn't use it, looked well clean and adequate. The room was quite the big enough and well furnished. The bed was hard and comfortable while the toilet was neat and well maintained. The Valentine's dinner was spectacular. While conducting an online review for management after checking out, I complained that the rooms be ventilated regularly, it was was well and thankfully acknowledged.

The South African Protea chain is a good chain and as expected this was no different. Though quietly tucked away in a close abit off the main road which could prove a little difficult to access, i would consider it as really private away from the usual bustle of the Island.  The facilities are good, fairly large room which had all the amenities and stunning sea view, large bathroom also. Internet was fast but not without a few glitches (as is prevalent in Nigeria). The facility also has a fairly standard pool and nice a bar. Security consiousness was also major here. Breakfast was abit of a downer but then the ambienece and nice staff made up abit for it. If need of a very calm serene place to stay whilst in Lagos, ring up this alley.. just be sure you'd have to eat out most

Review Title: Perfect... Until you order for room service
Review Text: This is actually a cool place to hide in the city. Courteous and professional hotel personnel, most had smiles to greet you. The ambience is great. My friend wanted to study all weekend and I believe it worked. Great lighting for narcissists like me who have to take photos everywhere.   The net door in front of the balcony door is due for repair/replacement as mosquitoes trapped in between both doors eventually came in.  Do not order for room service if you cannot wait for an hour or more for your meal to arrive. Even a bottle of Hennessey took over an hour to be delivered. Go to the restaurant because for some strange reason, the food they bring to the room doesn't even taste as good as the one served in the restaurant. The only thing we ordered that was sweet and felt fresh

Hotel service that was arranged to fetch from airport was delayed and I could not contact the person. Also no name or hotel dashboard I think they send over Uber driver to do service.  Rooms very basic and far away in quality from the hotels around. Also after complaining about service they done totally nothing about that.

The staff were very friendly and tried their best but appeared to have not been trained in hospitality. The menu is very limited. I ordered room service the first night and it took 90 minutes to arrive and no cutlery was brought, despite phoning room service  it never arrived. Next night I was the only one in the restaurant and it took over an hour for a burger with no burger bun. Positive is that the room was ok. Shower poor, never again

The hotel has a lovely set up and it very well furnished and sylish. The room was cozy and well stocked. The service by all the staff was superb as they were attentive to the guests' needs and prompt. Would definitely recommend. I do wish the hotel had more direct access to the water though. that would have improve the experience.
Review Text

Although the Ambience is cool, the reception service is not awesome , the food not so fantastic and the rooms are small. Would not recommend this place.  The room I stayed had no bathtub, just the shower. No dryer . No ports in the bathroom for shaving. The bathroom is also small.

Got into this hotel night  and I was wowed by the ambience  and aesthetics. We were welcomed by very warm  receptionists and check in was  a breeze but that's  where the magic ended  for me.  Room (407) had a damp and musky smell. The  room floor  was wet / cold  and so uncomfortable to walk  around. The room was filthy. There was used soap paper in d wardrobe, there was stains on d bathroom door , the  tea cups were unusable with coffee spilled everywhere making the tray sticky.  I couldn't  manage to sleep, that  crisp  freshness you  get  when you spend the nite in  clean hotel  was lacking.   The  next morning  at the pool was  worse, everywhere  was filthy. Felt like the pool  area  hadn't  been swept mopped  or used in weeks. Especially the  place where you take a shower

I am a frequent traveler to Lagos and this is my first time at this hotel. very clean, quiet and beautiful environment/room. The Front Desk staff are awesome!  very welcoming and very friendly. The Services are very good. One unique experience for me was that in my rush to get out of the Island before traffic build up.I forgot an important document in the Safe in my room. The hotel staff made arrangements to have them delivered to me safely... This  is a TRUST issue  for me.. and peace of mind,  Thank you again. I will stay here again

This is my first time in this particular hotel and I did not regrade the choice of this hotel.Very nice and quiet location, welcoming staff staffs. Precious and Seyi the front office staffs I met during my checked inn and out were excellent . The location is very strategic for those whose destination is around the Lagos island. The breakfast may not be the best, but compare ŵith other hotels in lagos the breakfast buffet is above average. I will be back.

The Protea Hotel Kuramo Waters is a nice hotel with a great location on the waterfront in Lagos. Undergoing some construction work in recent times, it is a well located hotel on Lagos. Staff are friendly and helpful

Guess I was tired but what slow and unhelpful service in a make-shift reception because of ongoing renovations. I won't be coming back here. Back to other hotels like Eko and Wheatbaker. Really thought it would be great to experience something else...but not again.

Good stuff first: staff are very sweet and helpful. Location is really wonderful in terms of beach front and sea breeze. The rooms are somewhat spacious and quite clean. Now the real stuff: this hotel is two star at best. Staff are lovely and friendly but not very well trained. The place is a ghost town, absolutely no vibe nor atmosphere. There are some renovations right now so the only place to dine is in-room or by the pool and with the heat and humidity, poolside can be an ordeal. Finally, it is tucked away off the beaten track which makes getting out and about a bit of an ordeal. It could do with some serious up scaling and advertising to really become a 3-4 star place.

Review Title: South African hotel chain in Nigeria
Review Text: It is always great to find a known brand when you are not sure what the local brands will be like.  The staff is very helpful and friendly. My room (sea facing) was spaceceous and comfortable with everything that I require on a business trip.  There is some construction/renovation going on at the moment, but this did not interfere with my stay at all. Some glitches with the Internet, but nothing that I could not deal with (thanks to my technical knowledge).   The only area where this hotel did not live up to the South African Protea chain standards, was the breakfast. Variety was lacking and small quantities made available.   All in all not a bad stay, but maybe considering other options available at similar or better prices, not a WOW Experience.

I Stayed on business for a week - the room was large; aircon worked well and bathroom sufficiently large. The food does require a bit more work, as I had a hamburger and the meat didn't smell that great. The lunches, through, were good and made sure to come back for lunch daily from the client. I enjoyed interacting with the South African chef as well. The barman was courteous and introduced me to star beer (which is a decent beer). Overall the only disappointment was with the food received on the first day. The rest of time I spent at the hotel was really good.

Review Title: Hear the sea from your room
Review Text: This is the fourth time I have been at the Kuramo Waters hotel, and choose it as the size of the room is good, the internet is fast and I love the sound of the waves breaking on the beach right outside my window. Nice pool as well, so bring your costume!
Review Text

Review Title: Perfect location, shame about the hotel...
Review Text: I spent one night at this hotel. Hidden within a maze of winding roads, the hotel is magnificently framed by the sea, complete with crashing waves and cool sea breezes.  Unfortunately nothing else was spectacular, memorable, or unforgettable.  The complementary breakfast was basic, but adequate. My first room was small, but adequate. When I noticed the lock on my back door (leading onto a balcony) was broken, I asked for a different room. I was efficiently moved to a new room...with a broken lock on the back door!  The TV in the room was microscopic, and hidden in a cupboard. Internet service was complementary, but epileptic.  The front desk team was another highlight in a sea if mediocrity and untapped potential. Would I come back? For a romantic getaway, and only because of

Review Title: Choose if only there is no other option
Review Text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as the hotel I had booked was overbooked and I could not get a room. The Protea chain is a good chain and I accepted this hotel because it is a Protea Hotel. The hotel is located way off the main road with difficult access to taxis. The facilities are good, the room I got had all the amenities, but it was cramped with hardly any place to move which was a disappointment. The bathroom tub appeared weak and the water in the taps was salty. Internet access is available in the rooms via cable so if you are an iPad user or wireless card user you need to go to the hotel lobby lounge to get wireless access.   Though it was the middle of the week, the hotel was dead with hardly anyone at the bar or restaurants. I had the Nigerian dish of jellof Rice
